website_summaries.verdict: Dual USB outlets are a plus for users, but many are disappointed by the actual power draw. All 4 outlets can’t be used at once, as many charging plugs block the USB outlets.
pros: Wires connect securely via clamp rather than wrapping around a screw
Users choose between dual USB charging and standard outlet configuration
cons: Outlet’s electrical box is slightly larger than standard outlets, causing some installation difficulty
Tamper-resistant USB outlets can be difficult to plug into

customer_reviews.title: Outlets worked great for lamp project
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Plenty of power from the USB's. Perfect for my project.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: This outlet was really easy to install. It took me under 10 minutes to do each of them. The build quality is solid and fit perfectly into each location. I have a desk lamp, laptop, iPad and Galaxy Note 4 all plugged in at the same time. The best features are that I no longer need power strips nor do I need to remember where I placed the charger!
customer_reviews.author: Rodel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Looks great. Charges tablets too (since it provides an up to 4A charge), such as the iPad, Surface 3 (didn't test with the Pro 3). I purchased 2 more for the rest of the family room for convenient charging from the TV couches. If you found this review helpful, please hit the "Yes" button to encourage me to write more. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Photographer | Tech Pro | Outdoor EnthusiastTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Nice Unit, Will Not Work With GFI Circuits
customer_reviews.text: Unit is well built and the USB ports are nicely placed. My biggest problem with this unit is that the description did not clearly state it cannot be used in a GFI circuit like you typically find in kitchens. We have a newly built high-efficiency home with GFI circuits. The wiring arrangement is totally incompatible with this units connections. Truly wish the description had clearly stated "not for GFI circuits".
customer_reviews.author: Goldens821

customer_reviews.title: Charging rapidly
customer_reviews.text: When I plug my Google Pixel XL into this outlet using the cord it came with, it says "Charging rapidly". That's all I really needed. It installed pretty easily in my updated outlet box. (I'm just a homeowner with a screwdriver--no great electrical knowledge or anything.) As others have mentioned, the safety feature of this outlet makes it very hard to plug electrical cords into it the first few times. It loosens up after awhile.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Strongly recommend getting some good USB cables to use with them
customer_reviews.text: The couches we bought didn't have charger ports in them for phones. This with an old work box and an extension cord fixed that problem. I'm not sure what amperage we're actually getting out of the USB ports, but I'm not complaining. Phones and tablets that came with rapid chargers from the manufacturer charge in almost identical times off these built-in ports. Strongly recommend getting some good USB cables to use with them, like these:
customer_reviews.author: Jon Hazlett

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working, do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I know what I'm doing as far as electrical work goes and this was a huge pain to install. Once it was in it worked fine for about a month then one USB port stopped working. Now the other one is sporadic, sometimes it works, sometime it doesn't. Quite frankly this is a waste of money, especially considering the time and effort. If you pay attention, most of the positive reviews seem to be as soon as it's installed. I would have give it 5 stars for the first month as well, but long term this thing is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Rabies McGee

customer_reviews.title: Everything looked good and worked good until I tried to hookup the ...
customer_reviews.text: Waited too long to install and now I can’t return it. Everything looked good and worked good until I tried to hookup the white/line wires. The screw would not set, nor could I remove it and replace it with another screw. Needless to say, I had no other options. Used one of the feit two pack usb plugs I got from Costco instead. Would like a return/refund/warranty exchange if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Jail murse 808

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 4 of these outlets to install in my new house. Easy enough install and decent instructions. Less than 2 years later, 2 of the 4 outlets have stopped charging from the USB ports. The 110v outlets still function, but the USB outlets are totally dead. I have reached out to the manufacturer but they have not returned any of my emails. I would not recommend this product from this manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with plate!! Gold is not gold
customer_reviews.text: Does not come with Plate!! This is more champagne than Gold. Very disappointed to open the box and find out no wall plate was inside! The first Photos show with A wall plate. Even the box indicates it’s included. :( I’ve ordered the wall plate separately and will have to wait again to see if #1 the “gold” from a different manufacturer will match the outlet #2. If it will be compatible and easy to install on my own. Grrr! Kitchen is being remodeled, thus I have not tested out the install nor can I comment on the product or charging power at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Electrician here. Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I mess with all kinds of recepticles on a daily basis, and have seen some very cheaply made ones out there. THIS is not one! Bought this for myself, and was actually quite surprised by the quality. You don't see this brand very often in the electrical field, but you should! I will say, this is VERY pricey for a recept, seeing as I usually get standard duplex for around $0.35, but it is still worth it. Four stars only for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon T. Clem

customer_reviews.title: USB not fast charge at least for us.
customer_reviews.text: It took me quite a while to install. Getting the hard copper wires around the very little space the loose screw gives you is quite a mission. I plugged in an older Samsung S7 with a USB cable and it takes forever to charge. As others have mentioned, if items you are plugging into the 120 volt have large plugs, you cannot plug in USB devices. The item itself comes well packages, good instructions and extra face plates. All are black.
customer_reviews.author: Rog I

customer_reviews.title: Not a robust design, particularly with the clamping screws.
customer_reviews.text: This outlet has 1 screw on each side, not 2. Unlike the other outlets in our home, the screws cannot be loosened enough to serve as wiring posts. Wires must be inserted in the small holes in back. When functioning properly, the screws serve to tighten a 'clamp' on the inserted wires. However, this is NOT a robust design. On my outlet, the screw on one side seems to be stripped or dislodged from the clamping mechanism. It will not clamp down on the wire. Thus, there is no way to hold the wire in place. I cannot use it. Disappointed, but sometimes you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: robg2

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to find a location to use this several times, but was limited by it only having the single screwdowns. It had to be at the end of a run. I just tried to install and the screws won't open or tighten down. Stripped and worthless. The plastic enclosure would have still made it difficult to get the wires in there to begin with. Tried for 15 minutes to make it work, because I really did want it to. Nope, junk. Put in a standard $1.50 outlet instead, without issue. I still might have had issues using the USB if anything was connected larger than a small plug.
customer_reviews.author: ArcadeCab

customer_reviews.title: High Speed USB Charger Outlet,
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing more convenient than having USB ports in every room of your house, and this TOPGREENER TU2154A-W High-Speed USB Charger Outlet, USB Wall Charger, Electrical Outlet with USB ports is the ideal solution. It just takes a bit of knowledge of electricity and some movies on YouTube to be able to install these yourself. However, if not the handyman type or have not worked with electricity, then you're best to have it installed by an electrician. I fall into the handyman category so I was able to install these throughout the house, and they have been working as charging stations quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore Iorfino

customer_reviews.title: Great item to have with teens around!
customer_reviews.text: So after buying several hundred chargers that seem to want to run away from home I decided to look for a better way. I tried leashes for the chargers, but the chargers would remove the leashes from what they were attached to and both would sneak out of the house. After finding these outlets that screw into an electrical box they no longer can run away!!! A major win for me!!!!! Another win is to use a 12" USB cable with these. For some reason the smaller cables do not slither away as fast as the 3 and 6 foot cables do. All kidding aside these are awesome to have around the house and are easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Keith K.

customer_reviews.title: Not useful or usable in most houses
customer_reviews.text: I did not know that these did not have wiring to be in a parallel chain of outlets. Without four screws, two in/two out, they would only fit about four of the outlets in my entire house. And maybe not even that if one of my electrical loops happens to end on a light switch. I bought four of these, and they're useless. I'll have to return the whole batch of these. I can't even think of anyone else's house I'd take a gamble and try to give them away to someone. That's how useless they are.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Parry

customer_reviews.title: Caused nuisance trips of AFCI circuit breaker. Had to remove receptacle
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this receptacle does not work properly with AFCI (arc fault circuit interrupt) circuit breakers. AFCI circuit breakers are now required by code in most locations for new circuits. When I had this installed, my Philips AFCI circuit breakers with nuisance trip. According to Phillips Technical support, this is not uncommon and is likely due to leakage in the electromagnetic spectrum. As soon as I remove this receptacle, the nuisance trips on the AFC I circuit breaker stopped. Note: I purchased this in 2016.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Idea!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these to use in our kitchen since everyone is always wanting/needing to charge their devices in that area of the house. These are easy to install but they are a bit deeper than a traditional outlet so just make sure you have adequate space in the outlet box (i.e. not a bunch of wires in the way, taking up space). It's a great product and charges appropriately. It's not the fastest charger but it's definitely fast enough, comparably. If you're looking for an easy way to add USB ports to an area so that people don't have to worry about having a plug-in adapter, then definitely consider this product.
customer_reviews.author: OfficeJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great; Does not fast charger Galaxy S10+
customer_reviews.text: Got this charger back when I had an original google pixel phone. Worked great, and fast charging was triggered on that phone. I recently switched to a galaxy S10+ and based on the specs of this outlet expected fast charge to kick in but was sorely disappointed to find that it won't work. Given that the product description says "Galaxy" it seems misleading since it will not fast charge these new phones. Gave a 4 rating since it did do what I expected once upon a time. Minus one star since fast charging apparently doesn't work on all phones.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Works but not 5 star
customer_reviews.text: This usb outlet works good. It charges my usb devices no problems. It let's you use the usb outlets and the prong outlets at the same time. But, there's 3 minor flaws. 1, the screws for screwing in the wires are too short! I made it work trying different screws from my original non usb outlet. 2, the box is kinda big making it difficult stuffing it back into the socket. 3, it charges kinda slow compared to using a usb adapter. Because of the difficult install, it took me an hour! Overall I'd probably not get brand again due to the hard install.
customer_reviews.author: Tarzan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Glad I found this outlet as I was renovating the kitchen with stainless steel plates around the wall switches and wanted to keep the same. Outlets were 40 years old and not working all the time, so this was a great replacement. The outer plate had to be purchased separate and while I am not fond of plastic, ( my other plates are metal) you can't tell to look at it.
customer_reviews.author: AussiegirlIngridTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Attempt at Utility
customer_reviews.text: Everyone looking to buy one of these is in the market to get rid of all the usb plugs for iPhones, iPads, portable speakers, you name it. This will work if you have normal plug-ins, not larger AC adaptor plugs like for children video monitors. It’s also really deep. Or the housing of is deep, making it challenging to get it flush against the wall. The setup is not challenging. You may run into trouble getting it and the plate flush with the wall if you can’t feed the wiring back into the wall more. Would have given five stars if not for my complaints above.
customer_reviews.author: Vance Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Returned because both had issues.
customer_reviews.text: First one caused breaker to trip, no power. I put in a basic outlet and breaker worked fine. Second one, I had issues with the USB ports. They wouldn't hold a connection to charge. These are junk. Thought it would be an upgrade and be a nice thing for my daughter's room. Now it's just become an annoyance. And the plastic covers appear shiny in your hand, but in the wall just look dull grey. I could've lived with that if they worked.
customer_reviews.author: jean r jones

customer_reviews.title: Charges anything correctly
customer_reviews.text: I installed this where we charge our devices most often. At the kitchen counter. It allows us to plug in small appliances and charge two devices. Works perfectly. Charges our iPads and iPhones of any generation at the proper voltage. Our phones no longer get warm during charging when charged with this receptacle. One thing to note: It is large and fills the box in the wall. If you have extra wires in the box or a less than standard size box this may not work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tintin Norge

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, used for our Echo and phone charging.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this while at Lowes - it was cheaper and better reviewed than the one they carry in the store (won't big box merchants ever figure this out? stop stocking less than 4 star products on the shelf!). Installation was a breeze, though as most devices like this there is more space needed in the electrical wall box. We have our Amazon Echo in one port, and a rotating cast of USB charging cables for devices in the other. We installed this in a kitchen where it's on a GFCI end of a leg, powering otherwise the coffee maker.
customer_reviews.author: LV

customer_reviews.title: Cheap upgrade to home!
customer_reviews.text: We had two of these and just purchased 2 more. They are easy to install. A cheap and easy upgrade to any home! I love that we can plug in our usb devices and not have to hunt down a charging brick to plug into a regular outlet. We have one on each side of our master bed, in our game room and also in our tween daughters room. Will probably add a few more eventually as other kids get older and acquire devices. Will install in the kitchen if a GFCI model is eventually produced.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mina

customer_reviews.title: Like 'em, easy to install on a 2 or 4-wire outlet
customer_reviews.text: We've installed one of either the 4 amp or 4.8 amp high speed USB charging outlet in every primary room of our home. It's a convenience and a small, quick and easy upgrade for when we sell. These speed up charging and add a USB port where needed, getting rid of ugly add-on plugs and adapters. Though I installed one in my office near my desk, computer and variant digital stuff, in other rooms I installed the USB outlets in a location away from media - tvs and streaming or gaming devices - since those already have plenty USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: PenroseTribar

customer_reviews.title: Tamper-Proof safety feature impedes ease of use
customer_reviews.text: The USB portion works fine, but the Tamper-Proof 120v sockets proved very difficult to insert a plug. I'm going to replace these if I can find any that do NOT have these child-proof sockets. I don't have children crawling around on my kitchen counters trying to stick utensils into my 120v sockets, so I'm opting out of this safety feature, thank you very much. Somebody should invent a way to have this safety feature, yet disable it when called for. Or they could just improve on the design of the safety feature so you wouldn't need herculean strength to insert the plug. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: 5galloncan

customer_reviews.title: Quality, easy to install outlet
customer_reviews.text: I love these outlets! Very easy to install. Takes me about ten minutes total to remove the old outlet and install the new one. Wires slide into holes in the back and then you tighten down the screws. I have installed around twenty of these over time in our house. Only ever had problems with one. It worked, but when iPhone got to about 70%, it would say “accessory not supported”. It was strange but I swapped in another one and it worked fine. I also like that both USB plugs provide fast charging.
customer_reviews.author: BV in Oregon

customer_reviews.title: absolutely love these wall outlets!
customer_reviews.text: incorporating USB outlets with standard AC outlets is the way of the future and these are most excellent!... they look great and perform great...and, are used daily for both AC power and USB charging.... form meets function and we are very pleased... really cleans things up with all the former way of USB transformers either taking up outlet space everywhere or not being able to find one when you need it... we have several outlets throughout the house like these and everyone in the household, as well as guests just love them... they get a lot of use :-) ... well done, we are very pleased, and thank you! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Chris & dekeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Mostly good
customer_reviews.text: This works fairly well and installs like any other outlet. 2 issues. 1) The outlet itself it a bit larger than a traditional outlet, so you may have a little trouble putting into an existing box if the electrician left a lot of extra wire when the original outlet was installed (not a big deal, just need to shorten the wire, or be careful putting back in the box) 2) the USB ports are fairly close to the AC outlets so if the ac device you have plugged in has a plug of any size, you can't use the USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Works great and relatively easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Especially like the screw to tighten wire instead of tight insert. Tight insert from replacement were difficult to undo. Hard to insert into regular connections. Very hard. Have to work them a bit. Insert, wiggle, remove helped. Still tight though. Color not as dark as hoped. Very light. I probably selected the wrong color. Charge inserts work great. Not too tight or loose. I suggest connecting as you disconnect to keep things straight as you install. Hardest part was disconnecting from old connector.
customer_reviews.author: rlr

customer_reviews.title: My complaint is that the AC outlets are not easy to plug/unplug
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. I installed the first with no issue. The second one has been in the box until today, several month later, and it turned out it is defective out of the box. The screw to tighten the hot lead is broken and will not hold the wire. It's too late to return it... The first one which I've now used for a few months is OK. The USB ports charge devices with no issue. My complaint is that the AC outlets are not easy to plug/unplug. You have to force the plug in, which feels like poor quality. I can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: kjoc

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Good price and comes complete. I had bought a similar usb included outlet at the big box hardware store and had to but plate separately. Not only was the outlet more expensive but also the plate was a few bucks to add on top of it. This one comes with the plate and it's about half the price. As far as performance, it works well. Charges a Samsung 7 edge and fire tablet at the same time with no issues. I bought a pair on special and gave the other to my bro in law, they charge various Android devices and an iPhone and they've had no issues. Their phones and tablets charge faster too.
customer_reviews.author: techwiz83

customer_reviews.title: My wife and I's phones would vibrate like crazy for spurts of time with the battery icon ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for nearly a year, and then started doing a weird thing where the power would go in and out on the USB ports. My wife and I's phones would vibrate like crazy for spurts of time with the battery icon indicating it was being unplugged and plugged back in. After some troubleshooting, I confirmed that my cable was fine and the lighting port on my iPhone was also fine. Fortunately, TopGreener sent me a replacement, and it has been working fine for the last few months. Hopefully it doesn't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: Austin S

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, under designed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months then output dropped. Now it will only charge a phone that is turned off. Must be either under designed of very low in components. Had to change this from 2 stars to 1 star after receiving the following reply from Topgreener. ‘When the outlets have been overly charged with, iphones, etc. it tends to wear out quickly’. So they are saying it’s a poor design. This is rated at 10 watts and my iPhone charger is a 5 watt charger. So they are saying if you run this at 50% of rated current it will wear out quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I ended up using the screw-on face plate instead of the snap-on (both are included) because I think they look a little better, but it's nice to have the option
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to finally get these, have been eyeing them for years, and the price finally seems right. Install is easy- if you can use a screwdriver and know how to confirm the right breaker is switched off, then you won;t have any issues installing. I ended up using the screw-on face plate instead of the snap-on (both are included) because I think they look a little better, but it's nice to have the option. Will definitely order more, they look so much better than the bulky USB adapters we have all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: sisiay

customer_reviews.title: Failed the most important test
customer_reviews.text: How can a AC receptacle not be easily plugged into with a normal two prong cord. It fail this test miserably. it also was very bulky to install, plus no separation between the upper and lower outlet which sucks if you have some switch outlets. Kept one installed but returned the other one. Looking for aother one, but different brand.
customer_reviews.author: tbirdman

customer_reviews.title: Works great, can be hard to install
customer_reviews.text: This combo 120v/USB outlet does a great job of charging USB devices while two AC plugs are also plugged in. Realize though, that the unit takes up more room in the junction box. If you don't have a full-depth junction box, or your box has a lot of wire in it, then there may not be enough room to install the outlet. I liked that it came with a choice of two trim covers, a conventional 2-screw cover, and a snap-on cover that hides the trim screws. The AC outlets are much harder to plug into, compared to standard outlets, I'm not sure why.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Once again - pay less - get less
customer_reviews.text: Installed 2 units and of the four wire screws (wire thru hole) - two of the screw/nut mechanisms wouldn't work - so I just wrapped the wire around the screw. Not ideal. After installation, I measured the voltage in the usb - 5.2 - again not ideal. I attached my Android Pixel 2 phone and the amperage draw was 1.4 - should be closer to 2 for fast charge. Also note the body of this unit is pretty large - at least larger than the old units you might be replacing. So the space might be tight.
customer_reviews.author: Snowlion

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and work great
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these in strategic places around the house which keeps everyone happy. I've had several guests comment on how quickly it charges their devices. No more running around the house, up and down the stairs, room-to-room, to find the charger that came with my phone. I bought extra cables to leave at each charging area, so no chasing those either. One caveat: use good quality charging cables with at least a 24 AWG power conductor to get maximum charging speed. (Smaller AWG number is larger diameter wire, which means greater current carrying capability. Many cheap cables are only 28 AWG and will charge very slowly.)
customer_reviews.author: RacerX

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I installed one in my bedroom next to my bed. I have both my clock and lamp plugged into the outlet. I use it for charging my iPad and Kindle. It is great when you are in the middle of a read and you get the low battery warning on your Kindle. Just plug it in and keep reading. It was easy to install and a smart purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. B. Minden

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful...
customer_reviews.text: Outlet seems to work fine. Installation is tricky because it takes up the entire 2x3" standard box. If the box is metal, the terminal screws will short out on the sides of the box-even with tape barrier. I had to place wires in holes behind box and tighten screws. Then all OK, but a bit tougher to push outlet into box. Thi may be true of all outlets with USB ports.
customer_reviews.author: Marc E. Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: great solution
customer_reviews.text: we installed this as an extra spot for guests to plug in their devices near our coffee pot. It turns out to be so convenient that we often us it also. It takes up no extra space, both plugs can be used and both USBs at the same time. It seems to work just as fast as our normal charging station and does not appear to over charge devices. It was simple to install (it is larger than a normal plug, but easily fits in a standard box) and has been used regularly for several months. It is nice to eliminate charging blocks and have a spot easily accessible to guests!
customer_reviews.author: techguy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works great
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. It was quick and easy to install and fit well in the existing outlet hole. It obviously works as a standard electrical outlet and the USB charging ports work great to charge phones and tablets. We have BBQ's, family parties, etc all the time so we put this outlet in the kitchen where most people hang out so anybody can use it when needed. EVERYONE thinks this is the coolest thing and they all want one for themselves. I'm going to get a couple more of these for other areas of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Dean M

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Will Buy More
customer_reviews.text: I researched a lot of these before choosing this one. The only thing it doesn't have that I wish it did is indicator lights. The high ratings and the inclusion of two plates is what sold me. It took literally 1 minute to switch out. I am using the snap-on plate and keeping the other as a back up. I only bought one to see if it was what I wanted. I will probably switch all of the outlets out. It is a bit bulkier than the original outlet, but fit in the box just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle G

customer_reviews.title: Works better than some of the older models.
customer_reviews.text: Older versions by other manufactures didn’t have the USB ports spaced so you could use a three-pronged plus and USB at the same time. These are spaced a little better and I have found it usable with two three-pronged plugs and two USB cords all plugged at the same time. I use this in my Gearwall behind my workbench and it works like a dream. I like that the unit comes with both a full decora and standard decora faceplates. I found the standard to fit my application better but indoors, I would have used the deorative one that does not show the screw heads.
customer_reviews.author: PiperFlyer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation!  Solid Connections.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how easy this was to install! The connections are push in and screw down. Cheap outlets use simple push in connections that always fail. Better outlets use side screw connections. They are solid but more trouble to install. These connections are push in for ease AND screw down for sold connection. Awesome! The USB charger works well too! This outlet made a nice charging station for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Installs quickly and looks good, but if it doesn't function what's the point
customer_reviews.text: USB ports are seriously underpowered. Installs quickly and looks good, but if it doesn't function what's the point. All I can say is I can charge things using a USB with this outlet, what I cannot say is that it will ever be done charging. plugged in my Pixel 2 XL, which was at about 25% battery, after about an hour it was at 32%. Using the same USB cord and adding the AC adapter, I plugged in into the same outlet, another hour later I went from 32% to over 70%.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron CK Hartong

customer_reviews.title: USB portion FAILED in less than a week
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use during my kitchen remodel, so it was only installed last week and the USB portion has already failed. Since it's been more than 30 days (barely) since I bought it (so much for planning ahead) I can't even replaces it. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Renee P

customer_reviews.title: USB Ports Don't Last
customer_reviews.text: I bought this outlet in September of 2016 and the outlet portion works well, however the USB ports start to fail after about seven months of daily use. It will still work but you have to jiggle it just right for it to make good solid contact with any type of cable, but has degraded significantly as the months go on. It was pretty awesome when it was working to plug in all sorts of stuff with the 2 amp USB without the huge puck that normally comes with the chargers.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy Who Buys

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit in my wall box.
customer_reviews.text: Screws too short to get the wires behind it easily. Its control box was too big to fit in my electrical box in the wall. Looks nice but just didn't work for me. They need to shrink that box and make the screws longer so you have something to work with!!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Product fails:  poorly fitting AC receptacles
customer_reviews.text: Used it primarily for charging through the two USB ports. That part is fine. However, the tamper resistant function of the AC receptacles makes it extremely difficult to plug in power cords. Discovered this too late to return, but wouldn’t go through the trouble for a $16.99 item any way.
customer_reviews.author: One Person's Opinion

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and aesthetically pleasing to the eye once finished.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and aesthetically nicer than a plain old outlet. Turn off the power to the outlets! There are some videos to watch on YouTube if you're concerned with installation. My outlet has two black (hot), two white (neutral), and one ground. The new USB outlet only has three screws (one each for white, black, and ground). For the black and white, just clip the wires from the old outlet and strip the ends for new connections. Both black and both whites push straight into the holes in the back. Simply insert the wires and tighten the screw.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Working good and like the option in face plates
customer_reviews.text: Came with two face plates, one was the standard rounded plate and the other a more flat plate. It is deep and you have to position the power cords just right in order to smash it into the wall. But I got mine installed just fine and it's working great. One tip for installing it. Take the plate off while trying to screw it into the housing. You can screw it into the housing with the base of the flat plate but it's difficult if the cords make it a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: burnsb

customer_reviews.title: Does not support fast charge on my Galaxy s8
customer_reviews.text: This product does not support fast charging on a Samsung s8. At my current battery level, when I plug into this product I see "charging" and 1hr:54 min to complete. When I plug into a fast charge adapter, I get "fast charging" with a completion time of 1:30. It seems like a pretty quick charger but in my case with the s8 Galaxy it does not support fast charging. I'm also having a difficult time plugging things in without having to wiggle and coax it in.
customer_reviews.author: thomas a oneal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Upgrade! Powers 4 Devices with No Issues!
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy installation. The instructions were extremely clear and made the entire process a breeze. Took all of 12 minutes (which was mostly time spent unscrewing the original outlet). I've successfully powered an Xbox One S, a 24" monitor, an iPad Pro, and an iPhone 7+. No issues with charging speeds with iOS devices using Anker cables.
customer_reviews.author: CharisseNicole

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but description on line misleading
customer_reviews.text: description on line says 4.8 amp total or 2.4 amp each usb port. Actual spec on the printed instruction sheet states 4.0 amp or 2 amp per usb connection. Seems like a small difference but I purchased to speed up charging time and wanted the max rating possible. Disapointed but will install as it will still be faster than my plug in adapter chargers
customer_reviews.author: Craig K.

customer_reviews.title: Top CHARGER!
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to having bulky chargers hanging out of your outlets. The 2 amp per USB definitely makes a noticeable difference in charging times. Used this to replace a traditional outlet and it fit like a glove. Even comes with two different face plate options. Use this on a daily basis now for over two months and not a single issue. Install would require a basic understanding of wiring an outlet, and turning off the breaker that covered the circuit this outlet was on.
customer_reviews.author: BigBrez

customer_reviews.title: Every room should have these
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these about 18 months ago for our bedroom. Frankly, i was tired of having to keep swapping plugs to charge my devices. I'm glad I bought these! Not only are they relatively easy to install (remember to flip the breaker), but now i can leave my USB cords plugged in and ready to charge my devices without having to unplug my lights. They seem to charge my iPhone and tablet very quickly too! I just purchased three more and put them in two bedrooms and a kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Alias

customer_reviews.title: Great convenience
customer_reviews.text: Easy for average person to install. Put usb wherever you need it without losing outlets. 2 and 3 prong plugs can be in and still access usb, also small transformer plugs but big ones get in the way. USB could be more powerful but for price it is great. It will charge my smart phone so that's what counts
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Simple, effective, fast charging... if a little cramped
customer_reviews.text: It sure would be convenient if every outlet was like this one. Why only four stars? With a USB charger plugged in, it gets awfully cramped -- you'll have trouble fitting some larger plugs in the sockets. That might be par for the course for this kind of receptacle, though. A caveat: The first time I tried this I got a 'slow charging' warning from my phone. Turns out it was the cable, not the outlet. Just be aware.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Kantor

customer_reviews.title: Cords matter
customer_reviews.text: I was going to give this a one-star review: Although being rated 2.4A per USB, about same as an iPad charger, I left my tablet charging all day (screen on), and came home to lower battery level than I'd left with. Damn. But before I slammed the product I did some reading on here, and saw someone had noted that USB cables matter. They were right. Although I'd chosen a short, fat one, it just wasn't as good as the one I'd been using with the iPad charger.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: No more USB chargers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for areas in our home where we always had USB chargers for our devices. Now they're no longer necessary. The only problem is larger plugs in the normal outlets make it hard to insert the USB cable, but they work well and charge quickly.
customer_reviews.author: James Leonard

customer_reviews.title: UL approved!
customer_reviews.text: I had tried some others but most were not UL approved. If putting this in your house you will want this as it's required do many insurers I believe if it caused the fire. While it is UL approved and it does provide 2+Amps which will Charge a tablet or large smartphone it is not fast or quick charge. This makes a difference for Samsung and Android phones. I removed a star for this as it could reduce charging time by 30min or more depending on the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Dan DurigTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: I should have know the design is problematic
customer_reviews.text: Just look at the picture of the duplex outlet and you could surmise that no USB device can be used if the 110v plug is being used. My telephones tell me that this is a low voltage power source and that recharging will be a longer process that using their 110v adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: but not a great first impression
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and we finally got around to installing it - with some frustration. The box was big and we did have a hard time fitting all the cables behind and couldn't get it to sit flush against the wall (you can only tell if you look closely). Also, the plugs are so tight, I'm nervous we are going to break it or the plug anytime we plug/ unplug! Maybe that will loosen up with time, but not a great first impression. The USB ports seem to charge very quickly though, so no issues there.
customer_reviews.author: Marlys Brothers

customer_reviews.title: A very decent product
customer_reviews.text: Works great and looks nice with the screwless cover plate. Installing it was fine, but dang it is deep. It is 2 inches deep, leaving very little room behind it for other existing wires. For 2 of my outlets, I needed to cut the wires shorter, so it would all fit. Also, there is no way of screwing the wires to the side of the outlet, and instead have to be inserted into the back, leaving even less room to insert into the box. Overall though, a very decent product.
customer_reviews.author: ohjonny

customer_reviews.title: Installation was easy..
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy... after I found a eletrical box in my house (built in early 1950’s) that was large enough for it that is. If it holds up to the abuse of 5 kids and my wife constantly pluigging/unplugging and pulling the cords at all angles I will buy more. This is just a trial. It was nice that it came with two types of wall plates. Sucks that I ordered a wall plate for like $3 with it as I seen it was in the combo purchase section in amazon for this product. My own fault for not researching.
customer_reviews.author: DeadSpider

customer_reviews.title: Great way to reduce clutter
customer_reviews.text: We use one of these in our master bath, where we charge fitbits, headsets, and the like overnight. Have not tested with a phone or tablet, so can't speak to the charging rate of a high-current device. With a couple of short USB A to MicroUSB cables, it really keeps the countertop clean. The USB cables to prevent the brick on my wife's hair dryer from plugging in, which usually isn't a problem, since the USB devices are typically charged overnight and don't need to be plugged in for morning dressing time.
customer_reviews.author: GadgetTom

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on delivery!!
customer_reviews.text: the wire screw was unscrewed completely and worked over an hour to get it back in was very difficult because the screw plate inside the box fell and couldn't get it back into place was really frustrating on top of all the product is not sturdy iv purchased many diff brands and this has been one of the worst ones by far!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: * * Works with my 10' USB C cable * *
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a different brand from my local Lowes at first. It allegedly supported fast charging. Yeah, that was a lie. So I decided to roll the dice on this one next. I replaced the current one I had installed with this product. My wife and I INSTANTLY noticed increased charging using the same 10' USB C cable with this USB receptacle. This is what will eventually replace most of my wall plus around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: Welcome Yourself to the 21st Century of Convenience!
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and super convenient! I was able to replace my outlet with this TopGreener Hi-Speed USB version in under 5 minutes, including finding the right breaker switch to turn off the power! It powered my iPhone 6 from 13% to 100% in under 40 minutes, and conveniently supplies regular 120 volt AC power for other appliances. If you have custom outlet covers, such as oil-rubbed bronze, keep in mind that these only fit the square cut out, not the double outlet kinds. Square outlet covers are typically on GFI outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Beauregard

customer_reviews.title: Power charging solution!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so this is likely to solve charging two IPADS at the same time. I placed one in the kitchen and one in my bedroom. I might have to get more for the living room for when I just sit on the couch watching Netflix. It really is pretty easy to installed, the installation process was about 10 minutes. It came with well written instructions and it looks sleek in my kitchen. This is much better than the one I bought two years ago as this can charged high power electronics, IPADS, SAMSUNG S6, IPHONES with no issues. The previous brand I had took an eternity to charge anything.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Cuya

customer_reviews.title: charges quickly
customer_reviews.text: nice luxury to have the USBs easily available and not have to hunt down the chargers. so far i have charged iPad, iPhone and even my GoPro cameras via USB. disclaimer with GoPro.. if you charge battery in the camera and try to turn it on the camera does not recognize it correctly and thinks you are trying to transfer files. instead i use a charging station to charge the batteries and works just fine. i have also used the actual plugs for other devices with no issues con. the size is larger and took some finessing to get it to fit. otherwise install was smooth
customer_reviews.author: Chris Locke

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this sooner
customer_reviews.text: Great product, super easy to install (literally took 5 minutes) and works perfectly. It took me longer to figure out which switch in the circuit breaker box powered this plug than it did to actually install it. I still give it 5 starts, but for some reason my plug face (internal rectangle) doesn't sit flush with the outer plate. The inner rectangle is a little deeper/lower than the plate. Very minor and I didn't feel like taking it apart to figured out how to adjust it. Maybe I screwed it in too tight or something. I installed this in our rental, where we live, but if I owned the place I would install a bunch of these.
customer_reviews.author: B.H.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made doesn't charge fast!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality. Actually seems very poorly made. The plug socket is not exact and it is "very" difficult to plug and unplug a lamp. Not convinced the charging is really as fast as it claims. My stock Galaxy 3 charger is faster for sure. I recommend looking for a name brand outlet. Since it is installed, I'm keeping it but really don't think it was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Pb

customer_reviews.title: Say bye bye to the USB charger brick!
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Not having to have a power adaptor (brick) is a game changer. I use this USB charger outlet to charge my iPhone X and iPad mini and it's been working great. Installation was quite simple and didn't have any trouble in terms of installation. For some reason, the outlet part won't install flush for me, it's slightly angled. Maybe there is some wires inside the wall that are in the way?? Not sure but I am sure this is not the fault of the product. I just need to push the wires back a little so the middle part will be flush.
customer_reviews.author: futbolista

customer_reviews.title: It works fine in a brand new house
customer_reviews.text: This plug is what it looks like. A way to plug USB cables into the wall port. It was thicker than my original and almost brand new plug and difficult to get into the hole. Also, it does not charge as fast if you plug anything else into the outlets and we have a duel wire system to power the top and bottom plugs. But it works and is easy and we pretty much always have something plugged into this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Reich

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for cheaper model
customer_reviews.text: We bought a look a like product which was cheaper and looked great but the USB sockets stopped working in about 10 days - the seller did not respond so we replaced the unit with this one which was easy to install and looks great - more importantly it still works on both the power sockets and USBs - so highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Christopher Day

customer_reviews.title: Faulty, broken screws
customer_reviews.text: Warning: install before the return window closes - yours may be defective, like mine were. I had such high expectations for this product I ordered two, but alas BOTH of mine were defective. One had a broken screw - see picture. Half of the screw was in the bottom of the box, the other half in the connector. The second outlet was also defective - the connector screw was torqued so tight that when I tried to turn it the internal parts just turned with the screw. So in the end these became expensive landfill. You've been warned.
customer_reviews.author: KAnderson

customer_reviews.title: Glad I went ahead and did it
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty skeptical of these and i read reviews where its easy to install but just wasn't sure. After getting my first outlet in place and started to charge my phones without needing an AC adapter was a game changer. Looking back it really is easy, but it was hard to convince me until I actually put 30 minutes of time to figure it out. I will likely do my whole house this way. Glad I went for it!
customer_reviews.author: MountaineerWV

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great upgrade to our kitchen, solid build quality and it even came with 2 different types of wall plates. I thought the tamper resistant plugs would make it hard to plug things in but you don’t even notice the difference when using them. Its currently charging 2 iPad’s and works as expected. FYI you can not separate out the outlets so this will not work if you have one switched outlet and one that’s always on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like?
customer_reviews.text: I really dig this outlet. It's super simple to install and probably took 10-20 minutes. I regularly have my tablet, phone and laptop plugged in all at the same time with zero charging issues. You'll need a screwdriver (personally I love the free Harbor Freight blue flat/Phillips head combo for these kinds of jobs), and a wire stripper. This product will work in a standard gangbox but it was too thick to work in my conduit box.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Slow Speed Outlet!!!
customer_reviews.text: Slow charge for USB connected cell phones. High speed should be taken out of this misleading name! It does not meet new technology speeds. Pretty much all cell phones have high speed chargers. I simply plugged my usb wire into the outlet and my phone says it will take 5+hrs for a full charge!
customer_reviews.author: mahar23

customer_reviews.title: I contacted them and they gave me suggestions of how to best manipulate the TR feature
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in April. It was near impossible to plug anything in to it because of the TR feature. I contacted them and they gave me suggestions of how to best manipulate the TR feature. We tried for several more days to no avail. They agreed to send me a new one. Again, it was very difficult, but not as bad. It finally started getting a little easier. However, now in July the USB feature quit charging. Very disappointing experience with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Stockwell

customer_reviews.title: Everybody needs one...
customer_reviews.text: NOTE - This is an electrical outlet that replaces you current outlet. It does not simply plug into existing wall outlet. Some electrical knowledge required. I love this thing. I installed it at end of counter in my kitchen. You can charge your phone or other USB devices and are still able to use outlets for other things and, because it's high current, charge time is minimal. When friends/family come over they can charge their phone without hunting for free/accessible outlet. My Dad liked it so much I bought one for him and installed it in his kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, simple, clean solution
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, simple solution. Instead of an ugly big wall mount this provides a clean look, at the same time providing two USB charging ports. Simple installation; my only issue was that this needed to go into a shallow box so it was a hassle to "dress" the installation wires so that I was able to get it to go in far enough. However, can't blame this on the product, they need to have a transformer in there, making it a little deeper than a standard outlet. In fact, this one is better than the Leviton product, which is deeper still, so even harder to install. With a standard depth installation box you shouldn't have any issues though.
customer_reviews.author: farcha

customer_reviews.title: Really like it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine a few weeks ago and I really like it. * Came quickly as advertised. * Installed easily (Okay, I am used to replacing switches and outlets, but even a novice should be okay) * face plate snapped right on, It also included a screw on face plate if you want to use it. I "parked" usb cords on it for charging my phone and my kindle fire book reader. charge times seem similar to my "standard" plug in arrangements. I don't have a meter to verify charging levels, but at this point I am quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: Very simple installation, looks great when installed
customer_reviews.text: Anybody that understands how to install any type of power circuit should be able to effortlessly upgrade their ancient power outlets to these ones with USB adapters! I especially like that the chargers are 4 amps. These can charge my phone in less than 2 hours from 10% to 90+%. It also comes with a foward-facing plate that easily comes off to reveal the two screws that keep the outlet in the wall. Very easy installation and everything you need is part of the package. Instead of buying one of those $10-15 USB adapters that claim to be "super-fast", get this power outlet - you won't need a USB adapter and you'll be getting 4 amps from the wall!
customer_reviews.author: Fedor P.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty slick. As other reviewers noted
customer_reviews.text: Pretty slick. As other reviewers noted, its a good sized block behind the outlet face. It measures about 1.5" deep. Like any simple project, this can turn a 15m job to an hour quickly if you have to deal with any unforeseen issues once you remove the old standard outlet. And this happened to me. Was able to get it sorted but always be aware that things can be more complicated than they seem with this kind of replacement. And as you are dealing with electrical, always make sure you kill the circuit before beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Grp Cpt Mandrake

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works great and charges my stuff with no problems--this includes iPhones, and iPad, and a couple battery packs. I can use both ports at the same time without any trouble. I can't speak to the speed because I generally leave stuff plugged in overnight, but no complaints. Installation was a bit of a pain--you do have to make sure you have room in your box. I felt I should ding it one star because it is a little on the flimsy side. Yeah, it's not like there are moving parts, but it is noticeable during installation, and the wire connection points seem a little weak. All things considered, though, its a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fishbulb

customer_reviews.title: Great space saving receptacle - lots of wall plate options included.
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice USB and plug combo receptacles. I bought 2 of them for my home office remodel. They are perfect for connecting those USB devices in need of a quick charge. The 4AMP connection allows for a fast charge of my iPAD or iPhone! They are much better than having a bunch of adapters around taking up valuable plug space! I like that they included several wall plate options for me to match with my current plate styles. Definitely a great value. I have only owned for a few months, so hopefully the long term reliability of these is as good as they have been so far! Overall - I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SWG - Columbus, Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as hoped
customer_reviews.text: Installation was straight forward. However, to charge my iPhone 6 and iPads, I need to unplug the USB then reinsert. Don't know why this is the case. Also, charging the iPhone takes waaaaay longer to charge compared to using the Apple charging block. Quite disappointed with this product. In fact, I plan to replace it as soon as I find a more reliable unit.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Does not buzz or click like cheap USB chargers you may have installed in your ...
customer_reviews.text: Can charge two 2015 iPads. At the same damn time. Does not buzz or click like cheap USB chargers you may have installed in your car in the past. This model is high-quality and every house will want to have one or two wherever your guests all shove their phones during parties. Maybe in the future USB type-C connectors will power everything under 100 watts and you will need to buy one of those instead. Oh well. For today this is perfect. Last note, there is some price volatility (± a few dollars) on this item. You may want to check a historical pricing source to research that if you are considering to buy the ten pack.
customer_reviews.author: William Entriken

customer_reviews.title: Charge rate has slowed down considerably over time
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these receptacles. We noticed that it takes a long time to charge our phones now. Tried several different phones and cables. Same problem. I have one a USB current meter and can see the current rate has now dropped below 0.6 Amps per port, thus the slow charging. We are now back to using regular chargers to charge our phones. We have had these for about 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: pk

customer_reviews.title: Super-fast charging with these
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy - a friend suggested these due to the fact that I have multiple devices that usually need to charge simultaneously. I bought two, one for each of two kitchen outlets. It installed quickly (easy and under 10 min event for one novice and one person who had a little more skill than that). It's wonderful to be able to use plugs for kitchen appliances like the mixer while charging phones & tablets at the same time. Also, for some reason these charge devices super-fast, I was very pleasantly surprised by that. I'll be getting another couple for other rooms. Great, quick outlet change for more charging capability!
customer_reviews.author: An Urban Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Large internals cause a tight fit.  Manufacturer begs for reviews.  Works as expected though...
customer_reviews.text: After receiving multiple emails from the seller/manufacturer begging for a review, here I am... This works as expected, but was a very tight fit. I wrapped it with elecrical tape before putting it into the metal box I my kitchen peninsula. The ability to charge devices without a USB adapter sticking out is great, as the location is in a high traffic area. If the unit itself were smaller, and I wasn't nagged for a review, I would probably give a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Trebor

customer_reviews.title: Slowly replacing EVERY outlet in my house with these
customer_reviews.text: Love being able to always find a charge port when I need one. Lets face it - these days we use almost as many 5v USB devices as we do 110v. Its great having a charger available everywhere in the house. Plus they put out enough current to charge my apple devices and asus transformer. I found these to be no harder to install than a regular outlet. Granted, they take up a little more room in the box but I had no problem fitting them in.The quality was fine and I like my that they are available in black.
customer_reviews.author: GossFamilyColGA

product_meta.title: TOPGREENER TU2154A-W High Speed USB Charger Outlet, USB Wall Charger, Electrical Outlet with USB, 15A TR Receptacle, Screwless Wall Plate, for iPhone X, iPhone 8 / 8 Plus, Samsung Galaxy and more, TU2154A, White
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteThe TOPGREENER TU2154A USB charging device is designed to power up your electronic devices more quickly and reliably without the need of bulky AC adapters. Charge one device or multiple devices from a single USB receptacle. Charge two devices simultaneously while leaving room to power other appliances. The USB ports are equipped Intellichip technology, which reads the power need of devices to deliver optimal power and protect from overcharging and overheating.

Included in the box:


 * USB receptacle
 * Instructions
 * Screwless wall plate
 * Standard wall plate



Technical Specifications:
 * Compatible with USB 2.0 & 3.0 compatible devices
 * Charging capacity rated at 4.0A
 * Tested up to 4.8A
 * AC receptacles are tamper-resistant to meet NEC requirements
 * Back and side wire terminals accommodate #14 AWG - #12 AWG standard and solid copper wire for installation flexibility
 * UL-listed



TOPGREENER USB wall chargers are compliant with all required standards and are ETL-approved or UL-listed. As a longstanding partner to both DIYers and professionals, we have a large selection of products at affordable prices. Best of all, we offer expert advice to all our customers. Unlike your local big-box store, we will take the time to get to know your needs and recommend the right items for any job.
feature_bullets: Wall outlet with USB ports ensures all your devices stay charged while leaving room for other appliances. Charge two USB devices simultaneously without adapters
4.0A, 5VDC combined charging capacity; each USB port can reach up to 2.4A on a standalone charge (USB ports do not support Qualcomm Quick Charge Technologies)
Smart and safe charging with Intellichip built into the USB ports. Recognizes power need of connected devices, then delivers the maximum power that your devices allow, up to 2.4A per port
Child safe tamper-resistant duplex receptacle increases safety by preventing unwanted objects from being inserted into the outlets; complies with 2011 NEC Article 406.14
2 wall plates included (screwless and traditional decorator); back and side wired; 125VAC, 15A duplex receptacle, UL-listed

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,394 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
